contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|type=animal|date=December 2009}} {{Taxobox | image = Eid-Echse.JPG | image_caption = ''[[Psammodromus algirus]]'' | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | classis = [[Reptile|Reptilia]] | ordo = [[Squamata]] | familia = [[Lacertidae]] | subfamilia = [[Gallotiinae]] | genus = '''''Psammodromus''''' | subdivision_ranks = Species | subdivision = 6 recognized species, see article. }} '''''Psammodromus''''' is a small [[genus]] of sand lizards of the [[family (biology)|family]] ''[[Lacertidae]]''. It has six described species, which are found in [[Europe]]an and North African countries next to the [[Mediterranean Sea|Mediterranean]].<ref>[http://www.eol.org/pages/35980 EOL.org]</ref> ==Species== * ''[[Psammodromus occidentalis]]'' - Fitze,Gonzalez-Jimena-S Mauro & Zardoya,2012 * ''[[Psammodromus algirus]]'' - Linnaeus, 1758 * ''[[Psammodromus blanci]]'' - Lataste, 1880 * Spanish Psammodromus, ''[[Psammodromus hispanicus]]'' - Fitzinger, 1826 * ''[[Psammodromus jeanneae]]'' - Busack, Salvador & Lawson 2006 * ''[[Psammodromus manuelae]]'' - Busack, Salvador & Lawson 2006 * Small-fingered Psammodromus, ''[[Psammodromus microdactylus]]'' - Boettger, 1881 ==References== {{Reflist}} * ''Lipids in femoral gland secretions of male lizards, Psammodromus hispanicus''. Pilar López, and José Martína. Biochemical Systematics and Ecology Volume 37, Issue 4, October 2009, Pages 304-307. [[Category:Psammodromus| ]] {{Lacertidae-stub}}
